text: East Timor is divided into 13 municipalities (former districts), and one Special Administrative Region (Oecusse).Jornal da República: Diploma Ministerial no. 24/2014 de 24 de Julho, Orgânica dos Postos Administrativos The municipalities are divided into administrative posts (former subdistricts), and further subdivided into sucos.Data from 2004 census and official 2008 estimates from the Direcção Nacional de Estatística, Timor- Leste: District Priority Tables . Retrieved on 28 January 2008 Municipality Capital Largest City Area (km2) Households Population (2004 Census) Population (2010 census) Population (2015 census) Population density (2004) (/km2) 6 Aileu Aileu Aileu 52.0 10 Ainaro Ainaro Ainaro 65.8 2 Baucau Baucau Baucau 67.2 11 Bobonaro Maliana Maliana 60.7 1 Lautém Lospalos Lospalos 32.9 3 Viqueque Viqueque Viqueque 36.6 4 Manatuto Manatuto Manatuto 21.5 5 Dili Dili Dili 466.5 7 Manufahi Same Same 33.9 8 Liquiçá Liquiçá Liquiçá 101.0 9 Ermera Gleno Gleno 138.3 12 Covalima Suai Suai 43.1 13 Oecusse (SAR) Pante Macassar Pante Macassar 65.5 The borders of the municipalities have been changed several times. The municipality of Atauro was founded on 1 January 2022. ==References== East Timor
title: Municipalities of East Timor
